concept.title: Enable Login to APP and Service Controllers

section.p: In order to be able to log in to the Asynchronous Provisioning Platform (APP) and its service controllers, some settings have to be made in the administration portal:

ol.li: Choose Manage organization in the Operation menu.
Enter PLATFORM_OPERATOR in the Organization ID field.
Enable the following organization roles: Supplier and Technology provider.
Fill in the mandatory fields (red asterisks).
Go to the Account menu and choose Manage users.

Click the initial administrator account (administrator for INTERNAL authentication mode, or the administrator specified in the ADMIN_USER_ID setting in the var.env configuration file for OIDC authentication mode).
Log out of the administration portal and log in again to enable the changes.

Now you can log in to APP and change APP-specific settings:
https://<host_fqdn>:8881/oscm-app/
Omit the port if is operated with its proxy.
User name: the initial administrator account
Password: the password of the initial administrator

You can also log in to the instance status interface of each service controller:
https://<host_fqdn>:8881/oscm-app-<controller-name>/
<controller-name> is openstack, aws, vmware, azureARM, or shell. Omit the port if is operated with its proxy.
User name: the initial administrator account
Password: the password of the initial administrator
